pr_title: Issue #5832: add javadoc and xdoc Example for StaticVariableName

timeline.message: Issue #5832: add javadoc and xdoc Example for StaticVariableName

timeline.bodyText:
public and protected type

Shouldn't type be plural?
timeline.author: rnveach
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -53,17 +53,57 @@ * An example of how to configure the check is: *

* 
- * <module name="StaticVariableName"/>
+ * <module name="StaticVariableName"/>
+ *
+ *

Code Example:

+ * 
+ * class MyClass {
+ *   public static int goodStatic = 2; // OK
+ *   private static int BadStatic = 2; // violation, name 'BadStatic'
+ *                                     // must match pattern '^[a-z][a-zA-Z0-9]*$'
+ * }
+ *
+ *

+ * An example of how to suppress the check to public and protected type is:

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/naming/StaticVariableNameCheck.java b/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/naming/StaticVariableNameCheck.java index 65c6c1106..507b20491 100644 --- a/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/naming/StaticVariableNameCheck.java +++ b/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/naming/StaticVariableNameCheck.java @@ -64,7 +64,7 @@ import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.utils.ScopeUtil; * } * *

- * An example of how to suppress the check to public and protected type is: + * An example of how to suppress the check to public and protected types is: *

* 
  * <module name="StaticVariableName">

timeline.author: rnveach
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -53,17 +53,57 @@ * An example of how to configure the check is: *

* 
- * <module name="StaticVariableName"/>
+ * <module name="StaticVariableName"/>
+ *
+ *

Code Example:

+ * 
+ * class MyClass {
+ *   public static int goodStatic = 2; // OK
+ *   private static int BadStatic = 2; // violation, name 'BadStatic'
+ *                                     // must match pattern '^[a-z][a-zA-Z0-9]*$'
+ * }
+ *
+ *

+ * An example of how to suppress the check to public and protected type is: + *

+ * 
+ * <module name="StaticVariableName">
+ *   <property name="applyToPublic" value="false"/>
+ *   <property name="applyToProtected" value="false"/>
+ * </module>
+ *
+ *

Code Example:

+ * 
+ * class MyClass {
+ *   public static int GoodStatic1 = 2; // OK
+ *   protected static int GoodStatic2 = 2; //OK
+ *   private static int goodStatic = 2 // OK
+ *   private static int BadStatic = 2; // violation, name 'BadStatic'
+ *                                     // must match pattern '^[a-z][a-zA-Z0-9]*$'
+ * }
  *
*

* An example of how to configure the check for names that begin with - * a lower case letter, followed by letters, digits, and underscores is: + * a lower case letter, followed by letters, digits, and underscores. + * Also, suppress the check from being applied to private and package-private type:

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/naming/StaticVariableNameCheck.java b/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/naming/StaticVariableNameCheck.java index 65c6c1106..507b20491 100644 --- a/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/naming/StaticVariableNameCheck.java +++ b/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/naming/StaticVariableNameCheck.java @@ -64,7 +64,7 @@ import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.utils.ScopeUtil; * } * *

- * An example of how to suppress the check to public and protected type is: + * An example of how to suppress the check to public and protected types is: *

* 
  * <module name="StaticVariableName">
